segments.text: What ’ s the area of your country ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It ’ s not very big . It ’ s a little over half a million square kilometers .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That sounds quite big ! How many people live there ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There are about 30 million people in my country . Most of them live in the north .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s the really hard to say . I think most people earn about two thousand dollars a month , if you convert the money from our currency into dollars .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So your country is fairly rich .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think we are richer than most countries , but not as rich as countries in western Europe . Our biggest problem at the moment is unemployment , which is roughly 8 % . It has doubled over the last four years .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Unemployment in my country is a fraction of that .
segments.speaker: S1
